page.title: 12Change around Park Cross.
page.content: In Norman times this area was a royal hunting park and the word{'park' continues to exist in many of the place names.Today it is almost entirely{farmland}and it is likely to remain so.In recent times several farms have increased in size as some of the smaller farms have ceased farming and their fields have been sold.It is likely that this trend towards larger farms will continue. Employment in the area suffered when the cigarette lighter factory on the Dixon's site finally closed in 1983 and it remains vacant.There has been some new housing development on the site of an old brickworks at Gunville but large scale development is unlkely.Although the railway closed in 1953 public transport remains fairly good as the area is served by the bus routes to the West Wight.
